ar: وَاذْكُرْ فِى الْكِتَبِ مَرْيَمَ إِذِ انتَبَذَتْ مِنْ أَهْلِهَا مَكَانًا شَرْقِيًّا
en: And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.

ar: فَاتَّخَذَتْ مِن دُونِهِمْ حِجَابًا فَأَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْهَا رُوحَنَا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَهَا بَشَرًا سَوِيًّا
en: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel [i.e., Gabriel], and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.

ar: قَالَتْ إِنِّى أَعُوذُ بِالرَّحْمَنِ مِنكَ إِن كُنتَ تَقِيًّا
en: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allah."

ar: قَالَ إِنَّمَا أَنَا رَسُولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلَمًا زَكِيًّا
en: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy [i.e., son]."

ar: قَالَتْ أَنَّى يَكُونُ لِى غُلَمٌ وَلَمْ يَمْسَسْنِى بَشَرٌ وَلَمْ أَكُ بَغِيًّا
en: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"

ar: قَالَ كَذَلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَىَّ هَيِّنٌ وَلِنَجْعَلَهُ ءَايَةً لِّلنَّاسِ وَرَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَكَانَ أَمْرًا مَّقْضِيًّا
en: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.'"
So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.

ar: فَأَجَاءَهَا الْمَخَاضُ إِلَى جِذْعِ النَّخْلَةِ قَالَتْ يَلَيْتَنِى مِتُّ قَبْلَ هَذَا وَكُنتُ نَسْيًا مَّنسِيًّا
en: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten."

ar: فَنَادَىهَا مِن تَحْتِهَا أَلَّا تَحْزَنِى قَدْ جَعَلَ رَبُّكِ تَحْتَكِ سَرِيًّا
en: But he called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.

ar: وَهُزِّى إِلَيْكِ بِجِذْعِ النَّخْلَةِ تُسَقِطْ عَلَيْكِ رُطَبًا جَنِيًّا
en: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.

ar: فَكُلِى وَاشْرَبِى وَقَرِّى عَيْنًا فَإِمَّا تَرَيِنَّ مِنَ الْبَشَرِ أَحَدًا فَقُولِى إِنِّى نَذَرْتُ لِلرَّحْمَنِ صَوْمًا فَلَنْ أُكَلِّمَ الْيَوْمَ إِنسِيًّا
en: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.'"
Then she brought him to her people, carrying him.
They said, "O Mary,
you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.
O sister [i.e., descendant] of Aaron,
your father was not a man of evil,
nor was your mother unchaste."
So she pointed to him.
They said, "How can we speak
to one who is in the cradle a child?"
[Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allah.
He has given me the Scripture
and made me a prophet.
And He has made me blessed wherever I am
And He has made me blessed wherever I am
and has enjoined upon me prayer
and zakah as long as I remain alive
And [made me] dutiful to my mother,
and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.
And peace is on me the day I was born
and the day I will die
and the day I am raised alive."
